result.execSummary:
All charges against Brandon S. Dietz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon S. Dietz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dsmissed without prejudice.
*Reason: The defendant has paid the owed amount for the worthless check and related fees of $65 in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon S. Dietz

records.addlTxt: Order of Dismissal filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 02/22/22 sp)
Motion to Dismiss filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 02/22/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:37 PM Defendant Brandon S. Dietz in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant does not want an attorney at this time.  He was offered a deferred letter in September.  He has a money order for the restitution. 
Court asks him to provide the check to Atty Mutchler. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

Bond not addressed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
